result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Arendt #532212924 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph A Arendt #532212924 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph A Arendt #532212924 was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*NO CONTACT with Nellie W.
*Court ordered the defendant pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any domestic abuse surcharges/assessments). Court will waive all costs, fees, and surcharges it is able to waive due to an inability to pay.   Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $50.00 per month with the first payment due on 08/29/2016 and additional payments due the 29th of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed or late payments, an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.

*11/3/2015  credit amended to 157 days.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Court will not allow for Huber privileges.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Per Decision and Order signed on 11/3/2015: credit amended to reflect 157 days (not 147 days).

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph A Arendt

Prior: 1132 West Lincoln Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Received, signed and filed:
Decision and Order Granting Motion for Additional Sentence Credit. 
Parties forwarded copies on today's date.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence (seeking additional sentence credit).
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP case.

Defendant Joseph A Arendt in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  Defendant Joseph A Arendt in custody. Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations placed on the record.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 
Nellie W.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 147 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. Court will not allow for Huber privileges.

Court ordered the defendant to have no contact with Nellie W.
Court remined the defendant that he can never possess a firearm.

Appeal rights given.

Court ordered the defendant pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any domestic abuse surcharges/assessments). Court will waive all costs, fees, and surcharges it is able to waive due to an inability to pay.   Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $50.00 per month with the first payment due on 08/29/2016 and additional payments due the 29th of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed or late payments, an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.

Filed:  
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Vincent J. Bobot in court, defendant Joseph A Arendt not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Sentencing. State has not achieved victim notification, requests adjournment. Defense objected requests to proceed. Arguments form state and defense counsel. Court ordered case transfered to branch 45 which will transfer to branch 23 post rotation, and will be retaining this case post rotation. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case set for Sentencing Hearing on 7/21/2015. Defense counsel unable to appear, scheduling discrepancy. Case adjourned for 7/24/2015 at 8:30 AM. State will attempt to notify victim in this matter. If unable to notify victim, matter will need to be adjourned.

Defendant Joseph A Arendt in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  Defendant Joseph A Arendt in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution in this mater.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations on  a motion of the state the court ordered Counts 1 & 2 Dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Defendant Joseph A Arendt in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  Defendant Joseph A Arendt in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled. Defendant now in court. Discussion regarding defense counsel's requested to adjourn Jury Trial and waive speedy trial demand. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding Speedy Trial Demand. Court found defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right for speedy trial to allow for defense adjournment. Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent J. Bobot in court, defendant Joseph A Arendt not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel waived appearance. Case set for Jury Trial. State ready to proceed to trial. Defense request and adjournment and moved to vacated defendant's speedy trial demand. Court passed case to allow defendant to be produced.
Received & Filed, Motion and Motion in Limine.

Defendant Joseph A Arendt in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  Defendant Joseph A Arendt in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for Benjamin Lindsay for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer John Schaefer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 10 DAYS prior to trial. Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with N.W. or her children.

The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph A Arendt in court with attorney Vincent J. Bobot.  Defendant Joseph A Arendt in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant entered a plea of Not Guilty as to Misdemeanor Counts 2 and 3.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Banch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
